channel.title: scikit-learn on Some Title
channel.description: Recent content in scikit-learn on Some Title

item.title: You are shown a plot such as principal component analysis, and the distributions of these two data do not differ greatly?
item.description: When I was shown a plot from a principal component analysis, etc. and received an explanation that the distributions of these two data did not differ greatly, I had the opportunity to think "Is this really true?" It was. #Create data Create two kinds of data data1 and data2 consisting of three dimensions of x, y and z as follows. import numpy as np x = np.random.normal(50,10, size=(500)) y = np.
